message: Why prepend the dollar sign to the namespace?
https://github.com/ruidlopes/minimal.js
I love the idea but I think I would hate writing apps this way
It does look pretty tedious
I think its more of an aesthetic thing, to signify a global variable.
Although it is pretty ugly :P
looks hard to maintain: if you change the template you also need to change the place where you render it
you really just want to specify a context to run the template under
I mean, its super-structured and clean, but yeah... very tedious.
defunkt, you giving up on mustache!?
I think something like mnml would be slicker, but thas just me
that way you (or the designer) can easily modify the template and everything would still just work
i've never used mustache.js
but we're slowly moving more and more of github to mustache.rb
really? I'll probably give it a try :-)
@judofyr wouldn't minimal.js bring you closer to something like MockDD?
@judofyr dofyr
oops, ham hands
but I guess you could `function renderThing(thing) { $m(…) }`
still, it's not as useful as proper MockDD (it's more like Effigy) since you can't really open it in the browser, but maybe I'm the only one who cares about that :P
@locks well, MockDD (as in Effigy at least) requires another layer which takes the data and then apply it to the template
i see
so I'll just wait ;P
when you'll probably have to answer question about Mockle at rmu
https://github.com/hij1nx/weld - similar concept behind, uses jsdom to render markup on the server - neat :)
